title: Times Of India's Newspaper Booklets: A Reader's Maze or Marketing Magic?"
selftext:
It's frustrating when TOI makes us jump between different booklets, right? Why can't they simply continue the article in the same one? Is there some marketing strategy behind this, perhaps similar to how malls design escalators to pass by as many shops as possible?

Additionally, I wonder why they have two booklets in the first place. Could it be because they have two high-paying front-page ads that they can't afford to lose? Do other newspapers employ a similar strategy of using two booklets and this cross-linking complexity?
